protocol_name: "Isolating Specific Cell Subsets Directly from Whole Blood Without Columns or Magnets"
protocol_name_html: "Isolating Specific Cell Subsets Directly from Whole Blood Without Columns or Magnets"
documents: [{"url":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/57rjike.pdf","file_id":"28591","thumb_url":"/img/extensions/pdf.png","ofn":"Isolating Specific Cell Subsets Directly from Whole Blood Without Columns or Magnets.pdf"}]
description: The following procedure provides guidelines for isolating cells from whole blood using RosetteSep™, an immunodensity cell separation platform that isolates specific cell subsets during density gradient centrifugation. RosetteSep™ first crosslinks unwanted cells to red blood cells (RBCs) present in the sample to form immunorosettes. When the sample is centrifuged over a density gradient medium (e.g. Lymphoprep™), the immunorosettes pellet, leaving highly purified cells at the interface between the plasma and the density gradient medium.
before_start:
This is a general procedure; specific conditions may vary according to the cell type being enriched. Find RosetteSep™ protocols for a specific cell type and more information by clicking the link below.

 

https://www.stemcell.com/products/brands/rosettesep.html

manuscript_citation:
So E.C. et al., J. Immunol. Methods. 2013. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jim.2013.05.001.

 

Lymphoprep™ is a trademark of Axis-Shield.
keywords: Isolating, specific, cell, whole blood, columns, magnets, Lymphoprep, RosetteSep
guidelines:
High-Throughput Protocol for NK Cell and Lymphocyte Isolation

Traditional methods for isolating lymphocytes from blood are laborious and time-consuming, requiring precision and technical expertise. These methods typically involve isolating peripheral blood mononuclear cells (PBMCs) by density gradient centrifugation before enriching specific cell subpopulations using immunomagnetic column-based systems. Using these conventional methods, isolating highly purified natural killer (NK) cells from a 450 mL unit of blood is a lengthy process (taking up to 4 hours), and it is difficult to process multiple samples quickly and efficiently.1

 

The new RosetteSep™ and SepMate™ system allow faster and more efficient blood processing without compromising cell function or performance in downstream assays. At the University of Maryland School of Medicine, Dr. Ajay Jain and colleagues routinely isolate NK cells from large numbers of human samples. In order to streamline their workflow and achieve higher-throughput sample processing, Jain’s lab has adopted the new RosetteSep™ and Sepmate™ cell isolation system in place of their previous, column-based method.

 

See this Journal of Immunological Methods paper1 for the detailed protocol.

 

  • 1. So E.C. et al., J. Immunol. Methods. 2013. http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jim.2013.05.001.

 

Have a question about this protocol? Ask us by sending an email to techsupport@stemcell.com.
status_info: This is a general procedure; specific conditions may vary according to the cell type being enriched.

components.data: Ensure that the blood sample, PBS + 2% FBS (phosphate-buffered saline + 2% fetal bovine serum), density gradient medium, and centrifuge are all at room temperature (15 - 25°C).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Ensure that the blood sample, PBS + 2% FBS (phosphate-buffered saline + 2% fetal bovine serum), density gradient medium, and centrifuge are all at room temperature (15 - 25°C).

components.data: Add RosetteSep™ cocktail to the sample and mix well.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add RosetteSep™ cocktail to the sample and mix well.

components.data: Dilute sample with an equal volume of PBS + 2% FBS and mix gently.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Dilute sample with an equal volume of PBS + 2% FBS and mix gently.

components.data: Layer the diluted sample on top of the density gradient medium using the recommended volumes (see note). Be careful to minimize mixing of the density gradient medium and the sample.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Layer the diluted sample on top of the density gradient medium using the recommended volumes (see note). Be careful to minimize mixing of the density gradient medium and the sample.

source_data.protocol_name: "Isolating Specific Cell Subsets Directly from Whole Blood Without Columns or Magnets"
source_data.protocol_name_html: "Isolating Specific Cell Subsets Directly from Whole Blood Without Columns or Magnets"

components.data: Centrifuge at 1200 x g for 20 minutes at room temperature, with the brake off.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge at 1200 x g for 20 minutes at room temperature, with the brake off.

components.data: Remove the enriched cells from the density gradient medium:plasma interface.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove the enriched cells from the density gradient medium:plasma interface.

components.data: Sometimes it is difficult to see cells at the interface, especially when very rare cells are enriched. To maximize recovery in these instances, remove some of the density gradient medium along with the enriched cells.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Sometimes it is difficult to see cells at the interface, especially when very rare cells are enriched. To maximize recovery in these instances, remove some of the density gradient medium along with the enriched cells.

components.data: Wash enriched cells with PBS + 2% FBS, centrifuge at 300 x g for 10 min, with brake on low. Discard supernatant. (1/2).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash enriched cells with PBS + 2% FBS, centrifuge at 300 x g for 10 min, with brake on low. Discard supernatant. (1/2).

source_data.annotation: We recommend that residual red blood cells are removed from samples by ammonium chloride lysis to reduce interference with subsequent assays or with flow cytometric analysis. The lysis can be performed as part of either wash step.
source_data.thread_text: We recommend that residual red blood cells are removed from samples by ammonium chloride lysis to reduce interference with subsequent assays or with flow cytometric analysis. The lysis can be performed as part of either wash step.
source_data.body: We recommend that residual red blood cells are removed from samples by ammonium chloride lysis to reduce interference with subsequent assays or with flow cytometric analysis. The lysis can be performed as part of either wash step.

components.data: Wash enriched cells with PBS + 2% FBS, centrifuge at 300 x g for 10 min, with brake on low. Discard supernatant. (2/2)
